org.jetel.data

Interface ISortDataRecord

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExternalSortDataRecord, InternalSortDataRecord

    public interface ISortDataRecord
    Common interface for sorting -
    Since:
    Jan 16, 2008

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void free()
      Frees all resources (buffers, collections of internal sorter, etc)
      DataRecord get()
      Gets the next data record in sorted order
      boolean get(java.nio.ByteBuffer recordDataBuffer)
      Deprecated. 
      use get(CloverBuffer) instead
      boolean get(CloverBuffer recordDataBuffer)
      Gets the next data record in sorted order
      void postExecute()
      Frees all resources required for previous single run of component.
      boolean put(DataRecord record)
      Stores additional record into internal buffer for sorting.
      void reset()
      Resets all resources (buffers, collections of internal sorter, etc), so component can be used in next run again
      void sort()
      Sorts internal array and flush it to disk, thus reading can start Note: in the case of external sorting, when merge is necessary, other name would be suitable, it is named sort() to maintain consistency with InternalSortDataRecord

    • Method Detail

      • put

        boolean put(DataRecord record)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stores additional record into internal buffer for sorting. Implementors are sorters, which can be based on various algorithm. According to this interface, they must hold to this pattern: User calls: get() n-times sort() put() n-times User receives DataRecord items one by one by calling put() in sorted order.
        Parameters:
        record - DataRecord to be stored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • sort

        void sort()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sorts internal array and flush it to disk, thus reading can start Note: in the case of external sorting, when merge is necessary, other name would be suitable, it is named sort() to maintain consistency with InternalSortDataRecord
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • get

        DataRecord get()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Gets the next data record in sorted order
        Parameters:
        recordData - ByteBuffer into which copy next record's data
        Returns:
        True if there was next record or False
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
